newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus court jails Briton for drugs possession.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus court jails Briton for drugs possession.

text.p: A British businessman was jailed for six months in Cyprus on Wednesday after a court found him guilty of possessing cocaine.
John Jenkins, 51, pleaded guilty to possessing 3.3 grammes of the drug, but the court in session in the southern coastal town of Larnaca dismissed his testimony that it was for his own use.
Police said they found four different grades of the substance wrapped in polythene and hidden in his socks at an airport when he arrived in Cyprus from London last December.
Jenkins, from London, has been running a bookmakers agency based in Larnaca for the past seven years.
